div.bibl: Denni Hlasatel, June 27, 1920. EDITORIAL COMMENT BY DENNI HLASATEL

body.p: Bohemian-America is very slow. It waits a long time before deciding to take any action. Nevertheless, we hope that after fifty years of existence it will begin moving and start building a theater of its own.

In the Czechoslovak Republic there are many comparatively small cities which have their own theater buildings. Therefore, it is a shame for the Czechoslovak people of Chicago, the third largest Czechoslovak city in the world, that they do not have their own theater building.
